content.sub_configuration_introduction:
This rule has an object option:
"enforceForOrderingRelations": false(default) allows negation of the left-hand side of ordering relational operators (<,>,<=,>=)"enforceForOrderingRelations": truedisallows negation of the left-hand side of ordering relational operators
With this option set totruethe rule is additionally enforced for:
<operator.>operator.<=operator.>=operator.
The purpose is to avoid expressions such as! a < b(which is equivalent to(a ? 0 : 1) < b) when what is really intended is!(a < b).
